t: Ezekiel 30
Egypt’s Doom
The*p word of the Lord*s came to me:
“Son of man, prophesy and say, ‘This is what the Lord God*s says: Wail,*pn “Woe because of that day!”
For*ln a day is near; a*ln day belonging to the Lord*s is near. It*ln will be a day of clouds, a*ln time of doom for the nations.
A*ln sword will come against Egypt, and*ln there will be anguish in Cush when*ln the slain fall in Egypt, and*ln its wealth is taken away, and*ln its foundations are demolished.
Cush,*ln Put, and Lud, and*ln all the various foreign troops, plus*ln Libya and the men of the covenant land will*ln fall by the sword along with them.

This*ln is what the Lord*s says: Those*ln who support Egypt will fall, and*ln its proud strength will collapse. From*ln Migdol to Syene they*ln will fall within it by the sword. This*lg is the declaration of the Lord God.*s
They*pn will be desolate among*ln desolate lands, and*ln their cities will lie among*ln ruined cities.
They*ln will know that I am the Lord*s when*ln I set fire to Egypt and*ln all its allies are shattered.
On*p that day, messengers will go out from me in ships to terrify confident Cush. Anguish will come over them on the day of Egypt’s doom. For indeed it is coming.
“‘This*p is what the Lord God*s says: I*pn will put an end to the hordes of Egypt by*ln the hand of King Nebuchadnezzar of Babylon.
He*ln along with his people, ruthless*ln men from the nations, will*ln be brought in to destroy the land. They*ln will draw their swords against Egypt and*ln fill the land with the slain.
I*ln will make the streams dry and*ln sell the land to evil men. I*ln will bring desolation on*ln the land and everything in it by*ln the hands of foreigners. I,*ln the Lord,*s have spoken.

“‘This*p is what the Lord God*s says: I*pn will destroy the worthless idols and*ln put an end to the false gods in Memphis. There*ln will no longer be a*ln prince from the land of Egypt. And*ln I will instill fear in that land.
I*ln will make Pathros desolate, set*ln fire to Zoan, and*ln execute judgments on Thebes.
I*ln will pour out my wrath on Pelusium, the*ln stronghold of Egypt, and*ln will wipe out the hordes of Thebes.
I*ln will set fire to Egypt; Pelusium*ln will writhe in anguish, Thebes*ln will be breached, and*ln Memphis will face foes in broad daylight.
The*ln young men of On and Pi-beseth will*ln fall by the sword, and*ln those cities will go into captivity.

The*ln day will be dark in Tehaphnehes, when*ln I break the yoke of Egypt there and*ln its proud strength comes*ln to an end in the city. A*ln cloud will cover Tehaphnehes, and*ln its surrounding villages will go into captivity.
So*ln I will execute judgments against Egypt, and*ln they will know that I am the Lord*s .’”
Pharaoh’s Power Broken
In*p the eleventh year, in the first month, on the seventh day of the month, the word of the Lord*s came to me:

“Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt. Look, it has not been bandaged - no medicine has been applied and no splint put on to bandage it so that it can grow strong enough to handle a sword.

Therefore, this is what the Lord God*s says: Look! I am against Pharaoh king of Egypt. I will break his arms, both the strong one and the one already broken, and will make the sword fall from his hand.
I will disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them among the countries.
I will strengthen the arms of Babylon’s king and place my sword in his hand. But I will break the arms of Pharaoh, and he will groan before him as a mortally wounded man.

I will strengthen the arms of Babylon’s king, but Pharaoh’s arms will fall. They will know that I am the Lord*s when I place my sword in the hand of Babylon’s king and he wields it against the land of Egypt.
When I disperse the Egyptians among the nations and scatter them among the countries, they will know that I am the Lord.”*s
